pageContent: LOGINLOGOUTHELPPrinter FriendlyPageEarthfiles, news category.Share:DiggFacebookStumbleUponStrange Aerial Lights Like Texas -But Now Photographed in Indiana, Illinois, and Massachusetts© 2008 by Linda Moulton Howe Left: Kokomo, Indiana, one of series of aerial light photos courtesy of Dustin Cronkhite,taken between 10 to 11 PM Central, on April 16, 2008. Middle : Flashing light photographedthrough telescope around 11:45 PM Central, in Oswego, Illinois, on Saturday, April 5, 2008.Image © 2008 by Gabrielle Johnson. Right: Video frame of bright, color-changing, aerialobject above Granville, Massachusetts, videotaped over a period of 90 minutes between10 and 11:30 PM Eastern, on Friday, April 18, 2008, © 2008by Courtney Lynne Wilson-Merrill.April 24, 2008 Kokomo, Indiana; Oswego, Illinois; and Granville, Massachusetts - At 4:37AM Central on Friday, April 18, 2008, at an epicenter 38 miles northwest of Evansville, Indiana(38.450°N, 87.890°W), a magnitude 5.2 earthquake at 7.2 miles deep shook sleeping residentsfrom Bellmont, Illinois, to St. Louis, Missouri, Des Moines, Iowa, Michigan, Kentucky,Tennessee, Alabama, Kansas and Georgia nearly 900 miles away. Indianapolis InternationalAirport closed down for an hour while the control tower was evacuated. This was the first strongearthquake in the Midwest since 1968.Epicenter of 5.2 magnitude earthquake at 4:37 AM Centralon April 18, 2008, was 38 miles northwest of Evansville,Indiana (38.450°N, 87.890°W) and 7.2 miles deep.Two days before on April 16, 2008, in Kokomo, Indiana, northeast of the epicenter, residentsbetween 10:25 and 10:40 PM Central, flooded the 911 emergency center with 146 phone callreports about bright lights in the sky and a loud explosion or boom that violently rattled houses

and windows. Authorities were quick to say it was “a midair mistake Wednesday night” when atleast two F-16 jets in routine training exercises with the Indiana Air National Guard went too fastat 10,000 feet and caused a sonic boom on the ground.Kokomo, Indiana, has a population of 46,000and is about 50 miles north of Indianapolis.But MUFON received a series of alleged UFO sightings on the night of April 16, 2008, fromKokomo residents Here is one example:“At approximately 10:30 PM on the night of April 16, I was in the living roomwatching TV and my husband had gone to bed. There was a huge boom that rattledthe front window. My husband asked what the noise was and I went to the frontdoor to see. Off to the west there appeared a large object with lights all the wayacross it. It reminded me of a hair barrette with lights. It seemed to be hovering, yetthe lights appeared to turn. My husband came out to stand behind me just in time tosee the lights reappear from right to left until 5 lights were showing. Then it did it fora second time before it disappeared. The lights we saw with the naked eye wereyellowish-orange in color.“If you click on www.WWKI.com (see 5 photos below), click on the article aboutthe Boom and the bright lights. You will see pictures that someone submitted.Thefourth picture down is exactly what I saw when I first looked out. This was nometeor orF-16. They don't hover. We could not take our eyes off of it and myhusband, who is a Viet Nam veteran and a retired deputy sheriff, said he had neverseen anything like it. We are both certain that what we saw was unidentifiable. Thenext morning, when I went out to get the newspaper at a little after 5 AM, I lookedoff into the west in the same vicinity. There, in front of the moon was a hugeV-shaped dark cloud that reminded me of a flower vase with a lot of much smallerjet trails near it.” Source: MUFON.The next day, WWKI Radio 100.5 in Kokomo, Indiana, posted the following images on itswebsite under the headline:“Big boom! Lights in the sky?Photos courtesy of Dustin Cronkhite, taken between 10 to 11 PM, on April 16,2008. Take a look at these pictures ... after you do, take the poll and let us knowwhat YOU think they are?”Earthfiles cropped the photos of multiple colored, shape-changing aerial objects to give largestimages without too much pixel distortion; thus, variable image sizes. Intensity of patterns not asbright as Stephenville, Texas, digital videotape on January 19, 2008, by David Caron; or a digitalstill frame on January 20, 2008, in Glen Rose, Texas, by Joan; and not quite as bright as Dublin,Texas, digital still frame taken on February 9, 2008, by Wendy Gaitan. See comparisons below.
Kokomo, IndianaDigital Still Images on April 16, 20081)2)3)4) See MUFON Eyewitness report above.

5) Granville, MassachusettsVideotape and Photo on April 18, 2008Granville, Massachusetts, is west of Springfieldand about a 20-minute drive southwest from Holyoke.On April 18, 2008, I received this email from Courtney Lynne Wilson-Merrill, a professionalphotographer who lives and works in Holyoke, Massachusetts:Subject: Large area UFO sighting over Western MassachusettsDate: April 18, 2008 1:15:39 PM MDTTo: earthfiles@earthfiles.comHello Linda. A few friends of mine contacted me last night (April 17, 2008, around10 PM Eastern), as they were watching two light formations in the sky last nightover Granville, Massachusetts. They said the lights were in triangle formations, verylarge and flickering and "twinkling" red, blue, green, and white colors. It appeared tobe about two crafts and they were causing such a spectacle the entire neighborhoodwhere my friends live were outside watching it. When my friend contacted herdaughter (in Springfield, MA) about it she said they were watching the same thingover there and a whole bunch of people were out staring at the sky. I live inHolyoke, MA. and didn't notice anything up here. It seems to have hovered from the

southwestern part of Massachusetts up to the Springfield area. It seems very similarto what was spotted over Texas recently and might be worth looking into.- Courtney Lynne Wilson-MerrillThen the next night on Friday, April 18, around 10 PM, Courtney's friend, Dan Vierno, inGranville about twenty minutes southwest from Courtney's residence in Holyoke, called to saythere were two more bright lights with spinning colors above trees near his house.Interview:Courtney Lynne Wilson-Merrill, Professional Fine Arts Photographer, Holyoke,Massachusetts: “ I immediately grabbed my camera, tripod and my husband and was out thedoor (in pajamas). I drove right over there to Dan’s house. As we approached, from the road wecould see a very bright object low in the sky. I knew that was exactly what everybody waslooking at.My husband was trying to park and I jumped out of the car. Dan immediately grabbed me by myshoulders, handed me binoculars and pointed into the sky. I was looking at a great big ball ofwhite light just above the tree line and it was flashing with colors. When we looked at it throughbinoculars, you could clearly see colored lights swirling around inside like blue, green, red, pinkand gold. And it kind of reminded me of those flashing light toys they sell at Disney World forthe parades.REALLY VIVID COLORS?Yes. It was beautiful, like a bright pink, and red and green and blue and gold. It looked like it wasmoving downward ever so slightly into the trees.SOME PEOPLE HAVE COMPARED A COUPLE OF THE UNUSUAL LIGHTS IN TEXAS(JAN – FEB 2008) WITH A MERRY-GO-ROUND INSIDE A SPHERICAL OR DISC-SHAPEDLIGHT THAT HAD SPINNING COLORS BEHIND A GAUZY, SILVERY SURFACE.That’s exactly it – mostly white-silvery and then on the inside it was moving like a carousel in acircular motion of colored lights.Video Frames Excerpted from Courtney's Videotapes

Videotape frames excerpted to show color changes of bright, aerial object aboveDan Vierno's house in Granville, Massachusetts, videotaped over a period of90 minutes between 10 and 11:30 PM Eastern, on Friday, April 18, 2008.Images © 2008 by Courtney Lynne Wilson-Merrill.Courtney Videotape, April 18, 2008, Granville, Massachusetts“Here are the links to the three videos I shot with my new camera:• Canon G7 with • 35-210mm (35mm equiv) lens• F2.8-4.8• 6x optical zoomhttp://youtube.com/watch?v=Jp0PKX5-BeY The first video I shot after I looked through the binoculars and saw the colors and was reallyexcited because I began to question why it was there and what it was doing. So, I just grabbedmy camera and started recording the light without my tripod, which is why the first video isreally jumpy. After that video finished, I got my tripod and set that up on Dan’s front lawn andthat’s when I took the second video.WHY IS VIDEOTAPE #2 SO BLUE AND FUZZY?In that one, I zoomed in, but the camera has auto focus and wouldn’t focus on anything, so itlooks only like a light ball out of focus. [ Courtney does not know if her new camera can changeto manual focus.]At the end of one of the videos, I think you can hear me say I could try taking a long exposurephoto to see if the object was moving, because we were not sure. That’s the photo I sent you thathas the downward curve to it and I was at either a 15 or 30 second time exposure.” Courtney's Still Frame Time Exposure

Time exposure (15 or 30 seconds) on Friday, April 18, 2008, in Granville, Massachusestts, showsthrough the tree branches the very bright light that changed colors. There is a curve to the light trail,which indicates movement, in contrast to the straight and fainter star trails.See close-up of aerial object below. Both images© 2008 by Courtney Lynne Wilson-Merrill.“There was a second object to the right of the first white ball, and the second one was mainlyorange glow with the same colored lights dancing in the middle. I tried to photograph that secondone, but it didn’t come out well. You can’t really see it.HOW MANY PEOPLE WERE THERE?There was my husband and me. Rich Guzman was not there that night, but was talking by cellphone with Dan Vierno. Others were Dan’s girlfriend, Bridgette, and one of Bridgette’sgirlfriends, and a new neighbor across the street. So six of us there and Rich was at his housefurther up the mountain about five minutes away. He could see the same two lights from hisplace.We watched that as long as we could, about 90 minutes. I went over in just my pajamas, so I gotpretty cold. I think it was still out there when we went inside to talk about what might behappening.HOW UNIQUE WAS THIS TO YOU?It was completely different than the stars because we were comparing the stars, looking throughthe binoculars. Then we would go back to the stars. The object was a lot brighter and bigger –maybe five times bigger than the stars – and it had the swirling carousel of colors on the inside. Itdidn’t look like anything astronomical at all.The first object was moving down and the amber orange one wasn’t moving at all. In comparisonto some of the star formations, the amber one didn’t move with the constellations. It just stayedthere.”I told Courtney that Erath County Constable, Lee Roy Gaitan, in Dublin, Texas, described oneunidentified aerial object that he saw and videotaped on February 2, 2008, as “a spinning sun or

Jupiter planet throwing off colored strobe lights.” [ See: 021408 Earthfiles] Other Texaseyewitnesses said it was like looking at a merry-go-round covered with silver-white Christmastree lights turning inside of a hazy, gaseous surface that kept changing colors. Courtneyimmediately said, “ That's it! It was mostly a silvery-white light that had colored lights changinginside of it.”Granville's Richard Guzman Sees More Pulsing LightsOn Sunday, April 20, 2008Richard “Rich” Guzman is 39-years-old, with a background as a computer salesman and now isa detail mechanic for van servicing in Granville, Massachusetts. His house is about five minutesup the road from Dan Vierno's and is more isolated in the Granville mountains. An odd, colorful,flashing light first caught his attention from his bedroom window on Tuesday, April 15, 2008.Rich couldn't figure out what the light was that night and was even more surprised when hisfriend, Dan Vierno, called him on Thursday night, April 17, and told Rich to go outside to see atleast five bright, flashing lights.Interview:Richard “Rich” Guzman, Van Detail Mechanic, Granville, Massachusetts: “April 17th, Ihad a phone call from my friend, Dan. And Dan said, ‘Rich, you’ve got to look up in the sky.There’s something up there and I don’t know what it is. But I definitely think there are definitelyUFOs up there.’I said, ‘UFO? What are you talking about?’I’m looking up into the sky and I’m seeing these flashing lights and I grab my binoculars and he'son the phone with me at the same time (each in different part of Granville). He says, ‘What areyou seeing?’I said, ‘I see these flashing, silver lights and they go from silver to red, and then they went toblue.’HOW MANY WERE IN THE SKY AT THE SAME TIME DOING THE ODD COLORFLASHES?For me, what I witnessed? I’m going to say at least five or more.WERE THE FLASHING LIGHTS IN ANY FORMATION PATTERN?I saw three of the lights in a long triangle – it was like one was pointed west, another light waspointed north and one was pointed south. It was weird because the triangle was long - not facingdownwards, but sideways.THREE OF THE PULSING LIGHTS FORMING THEMSELVES INTO A FORMATION OF ALONG TRIANGLE?Yes, exactly. The one that I saw really vivid, it was moving and doing this little jagged movement- like it was moving a little bit and then staying in one spot. Moving a little bit and then staying inthe same spot. I don't know, I’ve never seen anything like it in my life.IF YOU HAVE ONE LONG TRIANGLE FORMATION OF THREE OF THEM, WHAT WERETHE OTHER PULSING LIGHTS DOING? WHAT PATTERN WERE THEY IN?In the triangle formation, they didn't really move. But there was one I found separate that wasbigger and more vibrant. That's the one I saw move just a little bit and stay still and then move alittle bit and then stay still.Then I could see just like a silver-whitish color. It’s weird. It’s hard to describe it. But I do recallwhen Dan was talking to me, it was like, ‘Rich, I saw blue lights and red lights and I think Dansaid green, too. But I saw red and blue lights.For me, they are still out there! (laughs) That’s what I’m thinking. I told Dan that and he cameup here yesterday night and they were still up there, but they were moving towards the west.YOU MEAN THAT YOU ALL SAW THIS SATURDAY NIGHT, APRIL 19, AS WELL?Yeah. Then the lights were moving more towards the west.And I’m seeing one right now. I’m outside right now and I’m seeing it. I’m focusing mybinoculars – yep, there it is! I’ll be a son of a gun! It’s mostly silver right now. It’s flashing lights– they look like Christmas lights. And it’s not. It looks like little crystal silver lights with ayellowish tint. And it’s flashing.IT’S SILVER NOW?

Yes, it’s silver now.SO, THIS IS EXACTLY WHAT YOU ALL SAW ON APRIL 17 AND 18 and 19?Yes, there it is. Looks green. Now it’s flashing. What is that?!SO, IT’S CHANGED FROM SILVER TO GREEN.Ye s .NO MOVEMENT OF THE OBJECT?No, it's not moving. It's staying still.DO YOU HAVE ANY WAY TO PHOTOGRAPH IT?No, I don't. Wish I did. I just saw red flashing lights! And now it's back to silver.DO YOU KNOW ANYBODY YOU COULD CALL AND SAY, ‘COULD YOU GET ACAMERA WITH A LENS ON THIS AND TAKE SOME PHOTOGRAPHS?’It's kind of hard for me because I'm up in the mountains, so there aren't really any neighbors.There might be another light there, but it's hard to tell because it's cloudy.TWO OF THEM ARE SORT OF BELOW THE CLOUD CEILING?Yeah, I think I just found a third one.SO, THEY HAVE TO BE UNDER THE CLOUD COVER.Yeah, there's the other one. There are three of them now.THEY ARE ALL DOING THE SAME THING?Yeah, mostly silver and then flashing red and then flashing bluish-green like. That is so bizarre!ALL OF YOU ARE CONVINCED THAT YOU ARE WATCHING SOMETHING THAT IS NOTASTRONOMICAL OR MILITARY?No, this is like flashing colored lights and - no way! This is the strangest thing I've ever seensince I was born on this planet - I'll tell you that much. I have never, ever seen anything like this- at all!” Oswego, IllinoisDigital Still Image on April 5, 2008Flashing light photographed through telescope around 11:45 PM Central,in Oswego, Illinois, on Saturday, April 5, 2008. Image © 2008 by Gabrielle Johnson.

Oswego, Illinois, is west of Chicago and Lake Michigan.On April 18, 2008, I received the email below from Brandon Johnson about a very unusualdigital photograph his niece, Gabrielle Johnson, had taken on Saturday, April 5, 2008:Subject: Stephenville Lights in Illinois?Date: April 18, 2008 2:03:31 PM MDTTo: earthfiles@earthfiles.comHere is the picture that Gabby (my niece) took on Saturday night, April5, (in Oswego, Illinois). I have included the email description of theevent that I asked Gabby to send me as well. I hope to hear from you insome capacity to confirm the importance of the event in relation to theStephenville Lights. It sure looks the same and her description matchesas well, including the colors match very well. If it's the same type ofUFO, as it appears to be (in Stephenville, Rose Glen and Dublin, Texas),maybe the “ military” theory is falling apart. Gabby mentioned to methat she and her friend were watching planes in the sky when theynoticed the UFO. It was silent, visible to the naked eye, and flashing thecolor pattern she describes over a 15-minute period.Here is Gabby's email to me, Friday, April 11, 2008:“Brandon,When we saw the thing, it was Sat. April 5, at 11:45 PM, Iwant to say. We thought it was a plane because there werea lot of planes in the sky that night. But we noticed itwasn't moving, so we ran inside and got the telescope. Itdidn't help.Then we thought that we could take a picture(through the telescope lens), and so we did.After we took a picture, it was even stranger. The thingwas turning colors and I remember what they were ... Blue,Green, Red, Purple ... in that order. We looked up on thecomputer to find anything like it, but we couldn't and therewasn't anything like it in my astronomy book. So that didn'thelp. Just north of the thing was (planet) Mercury. Therewere not many stars around the thing, either.Gabby”I was able to call Gabrielle's mom, Leah Johnson, and arranged to interview Gabby by phoneabout her photograph and the models of her camera and telescope that she used on April 5,2008, at her Oswego, Illinois, home.Camera: Kodak Easy Share M8838.0 mega pixels38mm - 114mm equivalent lensTelescope: Telestar by MeadeModel 60AZ-A2

D=60mm F=700mmFully coated optics2x Barlow LensInterview:Gabrielle Johnson, 9-years-old, Oswego, Illinois: “My friend and I were outside and it wasabout 11:45 PM, I want to say, and we were outside on my trampoline. We were looking at thesky and all the stars and planes. Then we noticed something else and we didn’t know what itwas, so we went inside and got the telescope. It didn’t really help much. So, we thought maybewe could get a camera and zoom in with it to see if we could see what it was. So, we startedtaking pictures of it and when we looked at the picture it was like blue, green, red and purple –very colorful and it looked like it was moving. Without the camera or anything, it looked like agiant, colorful star moving like back and forth slowly.WHAT CAUGHT YOUR ATTENTION IN THE BEGINNING?When we were on the trampoline, what really caught my eye was when we were looking up andit was like the brightest thing in the sky.WHEN YOU SAY BRIGHTEST, DO YOU MEAN A WHITE, LIKE SIRIUS, OR ADIFFERENT COLOR?Yes, it was like white, but around it was like bluish and greenish and red and purple.DID YOU SEE ANY MOTION IN IT AT ALL?Yes, but just a little bit. It was kind of like back and forth and up and down a little bit.SO, IT WAS DEFINITELY NOT LIKE A STAR OR PLANET?No.WHAT WERE YOU SEEING THROUGH YOUR TELESCOPE?It was very bright and big and colorful. It was very strange - a big, white color, kind of shiny,silvery thing in the sky, and it had blue, green, red and purple around it kind of flashing in thatorder: blue, green, red and purple. That’s what we saw.SO DID THE ENTIRE ROUND OBJECT CHANGE COLOR?Yes, it would change to a very light blue and then a very light green and very light red - almostpink - and then very light purple.HOW DID YOU ATTACH YOUR CAMERA TO THE TELESCOPE?We were holding it as still as possible right next to a tree, so we were leaning on the tree a littlebit so we weren’t moving. And holding it as steady as possible to take a picture.AGAINST THE LENS PIECE?Ye s .WERE YOU AND YOUR FRIEND SURPRISED WHEN YOU SAW THE PICTURE?Yes. When we first saw it, we didn’t know what it could have been. We were trying to thinkabout it the whole night. It’s very strange.YES, WHAT IMPRESSES ME IS THAT IT ALMOST LOOKS LIKE COLORED BEADSSTRUNG TOGETHER?Ye s .HOW DID IT GO FROM PULSING, CHANGING COLORS, TO BE A PHOTOGRAPH THATLOOKS LIKE A STRING OF COLORED BEADS?Right.HOW FAR AWAY DO YOU THINK IT WAS?It looked pretty far south of Oswego up in the sky where the Swan constellation is. We went inthe house for awhile to check the internet and my astronomy book to see if we could findanythng like it. But we couldn't, so we went back outside. But it was gone." Compare to Dublin, Texas,

Aerial Digital Still Image on February 9, 2008February 9, 2008, multi-colored “symbol” flashed in night sky between 10:30 to 11 PM Central,over Dublin, Texas, by spinning, disc-shaped aerial object. Digital image © 2008 by Wendy Gaitan,wife of the Erath County Constable, Precinct 2, Dublin, Texas. Compare to Glen Rose, Texas,Aerial Digital Frame on January 20, 2008One of many pulsing symbols watched by Joan of Glen Rose, Texas,at 5:30 AM Central, on January 20, 2008, seven hours after David in Stephenvillevideotaped pulsing symbols for nearly 13 minutes. Image provided by Steve Allen. Compare to Stephenville, Texas,Aerial Digital Video Images on January 19, 2008

From his home in Stephenville, Texas, home, resident David Caronused his JVC video camera to tape twelve minutes, beginning at 10:10 PM Central,near the Stephenville Clark Field Municipal Airport. He was on the front porch steadyinghis arm and camera against a post on the porch. You can hear the local road traffic steadilycoming and going throughout the videotape. You also hear David Caron speak periodicallywith another person in the house. At one point, the two discuss that the pulsing multi-coloredpatterns in the sky look like “hieroglyphs.” [ Hundreds of image patterns in severalminutes of digital videotape in which the pattern is changing twice a second.]More Information:For further information about unusual aerial lights, please see my books and documentaries inthe Earthfiles Shop and in the Earthfiles Archive:• 04/07/2008 —
